|website = [http://www.mansfield.osu.edu/ www.mansfield.osu.edu] }} '''The Ohio State University at Mansfield''' is a regional campus of [[Ohio State University|The Ohio State University]] located in [[Mansfield, Ohio|Mansfield]], [[Ohio]]. It was founded in 1958 as a [[land-grant college]]. Its {{convert|644|acre|km2|sing=on}} campus is situated in the western foothills of the [[Allegheny Plateau]], the North Central Ohio region, with easy access to [[Columbus, Ohio|Columbus]] and [[Cleveland, Ohio|Cleveland]]. The campus offers seven [[bachelor degree]] programs and three [[master degree]] programs. Students can start at Mansfield and finish their degrees at The Ohio State University, Columbus, with one or more of Ohio Stateâs 170 [[Academic major|majors]]. The [http://library.mansfield.ohio-state.edu/ Bromfield Library of the OSU mansfield campus] provides access to all the resources of The Ohio State University and Ohio Link. ==History== The Ohio State University at Mansfield was founded in 1958 as a [[land-grant college]] and was created through a partnership between Mansfield-area citizens and the state of Ohio. Soon after the [[Ohio Board of Regents]] designated Mansfield as the site for an OSU [[regional]] [[campus]], Mansfield-area citizens mounted a major campaign to acquire land for the campus.{{cite web |url=http://www.mansfield.osu.edu/HTML/about.html |title=About OSU Mansfield |accessdate=2008-04-27 |publisher=The Ohio State University Mansfield }} In the early 2000s, the Mansfield Campus Master Plan was launched to establish a framework and long-range (ten-year) vision of the future Mansfield Campus.{{cite web |url=http://www.mansfield.ohio-state.edu/HTML/initiatives.html |title=Initiatives, Mansfield Campus Master Plan |accessdate=2008-04-27 |publisher=The Ohio State University Mansfield }} The Campus Master Plan intends to provide for conserving the University's and College's finite and irreplaceable resources, unifying and integrating campus development, creating individual institution identities, improving the quality of campus environment by a commitment to strong planning and design principles, strengthening linkages between the institutions and the community. ==Academic programs== [[Image:John O.
